t: My*pn spirit is broken. My*ln days are extinguished. A*ln graveyard awaits me.
Surely*ln mockers surround me, and*ln my eyes must gaze at their rebellion.
Accept*pn my pledge! Put up security for me. Who*ln else will be my sponsor?
You*ln have closed their minds to understanding, therefore*ln you will not honor them.
If*ln a man denounces his friends for a price, the*ln eyes of his children will fail.
He*pn has made me an object of scorn to the people; I*ln have become a man people spit at.
My*ln eyes have grown dim from grief, and*ln my whole body has become but a shadow.
The*ln upright are appalled at this, and*ln the innocent are roused against the godless.
Yet*ln the righteous person will hold to his way, and*ln the one whose hands are clean will grow stronger.
But*ln come back and try again, all of you. I*ln will not find a wise man among you.
My*pn days have slipped by; my*ln plans have been ruined, even*ln the things dear to my heart.
They*ln turned night into day and*ln made light seem near in the face of darkness.
If*ln I await Sheol as my home, spread*ln out my bed in darkness,
and*ln say to corruption, “You are my father,” and*ln to the maggot, “My mother” or “My sister,”
where*ln then is my hope? Who*ln can see any hope for me?
Will*ln it go down to the gates of Sheol, or*ln will we descend together to the dust?
